TOPIC.HEAD: EIFFEL_DOCUMENT
TOPIC.TEXT: You should use this tag as the first tag of you document.

TOPIC.HEAD: TOPIC
TOPIC.TEXT: The topic tag lets you create a new help-topic. With a topic, you must specify either an ID or a LOCATION. If you specify an ID, this becomes the identifier of the topic. You must now provide in this topic a HEAD and either subtopics or text. If you choose to specify a location, you must enter the filename of the topic you want to insert in the tree. The topic will substituted by the root-topic of that file.

TOPIC.HEAD: HEAD
TOPIC.TEXT: Specify the head of a help-topic. You cannot use mark-up tags within a HEAD tag.

TOPIC.HEAD: TEXT
TOPIC.TEXT: If a topic contains text, you can put the paragraphs in TEXT-tags.

TOPIC.HEAD: FONT
TOPIC.TEXT: With FONT you can specify NAME, SIZE and COLOR. Example: FONT NAME="Arial" SIZE="16" COLOR="blue". Color is not yet implemented.

TOPIC.HEAD: BR
TOPIC.TEXT: The BR is a strange tag, because in XML a tag should always have a end-tag. If you want to use this tag, use it as a standalone-tag in this way: BR/

TOPIC.HEAD: IMP
TOPIC.TEXT: All word that you put in a IMP-tag will show up in the search-index and you will be able to find the topic in the search-results list of that keyword. The search is case-insensitive.
